body.name: Newbealer Garment Steamer for Clothes, Powerful Steam Iron, 284℉ Handheld Steamer with Non-Stick Ceramic Soleplate, Horizontal & Vertical Steaming, Dry Ironing, Auto-off, Travel/Home Use
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 16 hrs 58 mins
features: 【2 in 1 Iron & Steamer】 In just 25 seconds, this powerful clothes steamer delivers potent steam at 284℉ (10-12g/min), providing deep cleaning for clothes and other surfaces as well as effectively removing wrinkles. Additionally, it can function as a dry iron with a temperature of 257°F, making it a versatile tool for all your ironing needs. NOTE: Designed for 110~125-volt outlets only. Transformer+adapter plug necessary for 200~235V outlets.

【360° Anti-spill Technology & Easy to Use】 The steamer is designed with unique leak-proof, anti-drip, and anti-spill technology, allowing you to steam vertically or horizontally without any concerns about water leakage caused by tilting the iron. Embrace a hassle-free steaming experience and enjoy the peace of mind that our steamer has you covered.

【Durable & Efficient】 Featuring a diamond ceramic soleplate for quick heat conduction and enhanced scratch resistance, its smooth surface effortlessly glides over delicate fabrics. The visible water window allows easy monitoring of the 170ml tank, providing 12 mins of continuous steam to remove wrinkles and straighten clothes without frequent refilling. We recommend using demineralized or distilled water for best performance.

【Auto-Power Shut】 The iron is equipped with a built-in safety feature that automatically turns off the device after 30 minutes of use, promoting energy efficiency and preventing accidents. It activates immediately when the iron is turned on and monitors usage throughout operation. This provides peace of mind, avoiding damage or harm if left unattended briefly.

【Ideal Gift】 The clothes steamer is suitable for silk, plush, wool, cotton, linen, polyester, brocade and other fabrics. Its compact and portable design ( 4" X 2.5" X 8.3", 1.2lb) makes it an ideal gift for both home and travel use. With a 1-Year Warranty and a reliable customer care team, shop with confidence!

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Auto-off Function Ensures safety by automatically turning off after 30 minutes of use.This function helps prevent unnecessary idling in case of inactivity. No leaks at any angles. 8FT Rubber Power Cord Softer and more flexible than PVC wires.Say goodbye to struggling with short cords or needing to use extension cables.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Portable & Easy to use
reviews.reviewText: This compact iron has powerful performance, easily smoothing out three shirts. There's still a bit of water left in the tank, which is completely sufficient for me. Indeed, as described, it can iron from any angle, so ironing horizontally or vertically is both possible. It's a perfect alternative to the traditional iron at my home.I recemmend this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Compact & Effective Steamer / Iron
reviews.reviewText: I have a bigger steamer that I mainly use for cleaning but has a garment attachment. I've never really felt all that confident using it, to be totally honest. So when I saw this steamer/iron combo, I thought it would be perfect to fill that gap.It's been so great to have in the house. It heats up very quickly, and is super easy to use. There is only really one heat setting for the steam and for the iron, but that's just fine for what I need it for- it hasn't caused any issues with anything that I've needed to steam or iron. The iron plate is small, but in my opinion it's really just a bonus add on to what was always meant to be a steamer.I have used this thing several times and been really happy with the results each time- whether I'm steaming silky and satiny fabrics, linen, or something thicker, this garment steamer handles them all just fine. When I need to go in with the ironing plate for a little extra, it handles really well also. I haven't had any issues with burns or anything- it really seems like this steamer/iron was designed to be useful across the board no matter what it's being used on.This is a great tool to have around the house, especially when you've got a lot of people in your home and don't really have time to devote to ironing and steaming every little thing, but need to make sure that those things are wrinkle released before they are worn out. I have a family of 5 and it's been invaluable in our home.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Steamer works great
reviews.reviewText: Like others have said, it is a bit bulky in the hand. Though I didn't order it for prolonged use. I ordered it to be able to steam a shirt while it's on a hanger and for that this works very well. I have not tried it as an iron and I have no intention of trying it as an iron on a flat surface. To me it was a way to be able to get wrinkles out without having to fight to get sleeves over the ironing board. Sure it's a bit large to hold in hand, but I'm not using it for a prolonged amount of time so it's not much an issue. I'm sure there are other steamers out there that are better shaped to hold but I'm perfectly content with this for the few minutes at a time it will be used.Definitely use distilled water in it vs tap though so you don't end up with buildup in it over time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not ergonomic, iron not so good, steamer marginally better
reviews.reviewText: The dry/iron part does not work well. The steamer part works better. It does have a flat surface so you can rest it down while not using. The handle is not very ergonomic so am sure it gets tedious to use for longer than 10-15 minsIn short, look elsewhere

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quick, convenient, and will not leak
reviews.reviewText: Overall verdict: This is a great portable garment steamer that heats quickly (in less than a minute), lasts a while, and will not leak.I ordered this steamer for traveling. It’s convenient to keep in luggage and takes up very little space, and when the description says it won’t leak, they mean it. I filled up the tank and twisted and shook the steamer every which way to try to see if it would leak, and it just won’t, even when it’s in use. It takes less than a minute to reach temperature, and lasts more than 15 minutes when it’s full. This is definitely a great option for anyone looking for a portable steamer to toss in your luggage and forget until you need it.The only minor issue is that its small size means the power cord out the side produces a lot of torque when you put it down on a surface, so you need to be careful that it doesn’t twist awkwardly and fall. Still, this is a minor issue and is fairly easily avoided.If you travel (or just need a convenient steamer in general), this is a solid choice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I've used a big rolling cart steamer at home normally but it does take a lot of space and harder to clean. Switched to this portable one and enjoying it so far. It is easy to refill with water and convenient to use. Since it is a portable one, the water reservoir is not big. It's enough to steam one article of clothing thoroughly before I have to refill. The one side with this portable one is that it doesn't have a rack to hang my clothes while steaming. Other than that, it's very easy to use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Steams out the wrinkles
reviews.reviewText: I like this smaller steamer. It heats up really fast. You can use it upright or you can use it like a regular iron. It was easy to fill up with water. It is a little awkward to hold though. My hand is small and after a few minutes, it became uncomfortable for me to hold. I have a larger steamer that has a different handle than this, which has no handle. I will use my larger one for the bigger jobs like steaming curtains and bed ruffles. But for a quick steam, this will work just fine. It has a long enough cord to reach where I hang my clothes to steam them. It’s not heavy, so that is a big plus for me. This is small enough to pack in your suitcase and not take up a lot of space. I really like this compact steamer. It’s about a fourth of the weight of my big steamer. I give this two thumbs up.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice compact steamer
reviews.reviewText: This is a nice little steamer. My older steamer would get a lot of steam flowing for a while, then cool down and make you wait for it to start flowing again, but this one heats up quickly and emits steam in a continuous, pulsing fashion. I also like how it allows for horizontal usage as well, because my old one would spill out water if I tilted it too much, which is easy to do when steaming around a large item. As a dry iron, it is limited to low-temperature fabrics, as 257F is really not hot enough to get a cotton shirt smoothly ironed. But this steamer is really more about getting out minor wrinkles on already-ironed shirts and being easy to pack for travel purposes; it is great for this. The long cord is also a nice feature. I have attached some before-and-after pictures of a lightweight cotton shirt, and there is definitely a noticeable improvement after using the steamer. I'm happy with it overall, and I think it is a good deal. Just don't expect it to replace a full-fledged steam iron.
